title.rendered: Abu Dhabi vs Emirates, International League, 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Abu Dhabi: Paul Stirling, Brandon King, Joe Clarke (wk), Dhananjaya de Silva, Andre Russell, Charith Asalanka, Sunil Narine (c), Akeal Hosein, Zawar Farid, Lahiru Kumara, Matiullah Khan

Emirates: Andre Fletcher, Muhammad Waseem, Basil Hameed, Nicholas Pooran (wk), Najibullah Zadran, Kieron Pollard (c), Dwayne Bravo, Jordan Thompson, Trent Boult, Imran Tahir, Fazalhaq Farooqi

Venue: Sheikh Zayed Stadium, Abu Dhabi

Pitch Report

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 152

2nd innings average score: 173

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: —

Batting 2nd: 100%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

In his last 8 T20 games at Abu Dhabi, Kieron Pollard has accumulated 254 runs at 64 including the highest score of 86.

For the last 4 matches, Andre Russell has been a part of the Ultimate Team. Given his all-round impact, his selection percentage hasn’t dropped below 92.

Although Sunil Narine has blown hot and cold, he blasted 28* off 18 against Emirates a few weeks ago, and took the all-important wicket of Pollard.

When these teams met earlier in the competition, Dhananjaya de Silva (65 off 40) and Andre Fletcher (53 off 43) were the captain and the vice-captain of the Ultimate Team respectively.

In his last 5 outings at the Sheikh Zayed Stadium, Trent Boult has managed only 3 wickets.

Given the friendly batting conditions at the venue, an average of 6 sixes per innings has been smashed in the last 3 games.

In the same period, 25% of the wickets belonged to the spinners.
